answers.answer: Hi Sismi. I'm so sorry to hear about your brother. It sounds like he is at stage 4 liver cirrhosis. It is good that they are monitoring him. That way his medications and diet will all be controlled. I have seen a person come out of it within a few months. With diabetes, it could take longer.The medications can help to bring his status under control. With time, he can stabilize. I know you would like him to come home earlier, but this level of care may be best in my opinion.xo Karen:)

Hello,Once hepatic encephalopathy has developed, the prognosis is determined largely by other markers of liver failure, such as the levels of albumin (a protein produced by the liver), the prothrombin time (a test of coagulation, which relies on proteins produced in the liver), the presence of ascites and the level of bilirubin (a breakdown product of hemoglobin which is conjugated and excreted by the liver). With development is ascites, the prognosis is not good unfortunately.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

I'm so sorry to hear about your brother.  As to how long he will be there, only his Doctors can tell you that.  But with everything going on, I'm sure that's the best place for him right now.  I have heard many stories of people near their death beds, where families were told to prepare themselves...then they got better and with proper medical attention, diet, exercise and very importantly in my humble opinion a good attitude are doing well now.  I don't want to give false hope, but also don't want you to have a false sense of doom.  I too have been diagnosed with stage 4 cirrhosis, I battle with ascites (although no parecentisis yet) and a bit of H.E and I have diabetes and my kidneys are not at their best.  That being said,  Diet is so important I am finding.  I never really watched my diabetes as well as I should have, but with this liver thing I've gotten very serious about it and it is absolutely amazing what a good diet does for your body and your mind.  I am not in your brothers condition, the only reason I say all of this is because I very well could be but I am putting up a fight as is everyone else here, I found information and immediately started implementing it into my life.  There is hope.  I'm glad your brother has such a loving sister as yourself that not only wants information but actually  came online and reached out for it.  I will keep you both in my prayers.Shelley

question: My brother has had 3 hospitalizations in 2 months. First was bleeding esophageal varices, second was paracentesis and third was hepatic encephalopathy and now on lactulose. He is also a diabetic so he has partial kidney failure at this point. He is unable to get out of bed without help and can only walk one or two steps.   His eyes are slightly jaundiced.  He is in a nursing/rehab home at present.  He has had paracentesis approximately once a week where 4 to 5 liters of fluid is removed. I haven't had any experience with cirrhosis and need anyone's opinion on how long my brother will be here.  I know it's a dismal prognosis.
title: Cirrhosis diagnosis
